name: UK Summer Floods 2007
location: UK (multiple regions: June NE England; July central England, Gloucester, Tewkesbury)
source: Pitt Review, UK Parliament flood resilience reports, Met Office

timeline.event: First phase: severe flooding NE England (Sheffield, Doncaster, Hull)
Heavy rainfall begins; south Midlands and Wales
Peak rainfall; >200 mm in places (4× July average); worst in 60 years
Central England: Oxford, Gloucester, Tewkesbury severely affected
55,000+ homes and businesses flooded; multi-agency response
Multi-agency coordination reported 3–5 hours for coordinated actions

coordination_steps_traditional: Insufficient clarity over leadership for adaptation
Only 12% of UK experts thought government performed well (comparative studies)
notes: Storm Desmond (Dec 2015) is the event with full Munin demo: see carlisle_storm_desmond fixtures and CARLISLE_DEMO_SETUP.md. UK 2007 and 2011 floods share the same coordination-bottleneck pattern.
munin_counterfactual: Pre-validated cross-government flood playbooks; single coordination layer; 3–5 h → <5 min authorisation.
